original_title: CCPI based headline inflation records another sharp decline in June 2023
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Headline inflation, as measured by the year-on-year change in the Colombo Consumer Price Index decreased to 12.0% in June 2023 from 25.2% in May 2023.
The decline in the headline inflation is broadly in line with the disinflation path envisaged by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka in April 2023.

After two years, the Food inflation decreased to a single digit level of 4.1% in June 2023 from 21.5% in May 2023, while the Non-Food inflation decreased further to 16.2% in June 2023 from 27.0% in May 2023.

Monthly change of CCPI recorded at 0.02% in June 2023 and this marginal change was due to the netting off of price increases observed in the items of Food category, which was 0.41% by the price decreases observed in the Non-Food category, which was -0.39%.
The core inflation, which reflects the underlying inflation in the economy, decreased to 9.8% in June 2023 from 20.3% in May 2023.
